alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 10 at 8:17PM PST until January 12 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO 6 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet with local sets to 10 feet, and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Coast. * WHEN...From noon Tuesday to 6 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning due to the dangerous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will be highest on exposed west facing beaches.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.
